verses.text: For Zion’s sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp that* burneth.
And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** shall name.
Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.

Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzi-bah, and thy land Beulah: for the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.+ 62.4 Hephzi-bah: that is, My delight is in her*+ 62.4 Beulah: that is, Married*

¶ For as* a young man marrieth a virgin, so* shall thy sons marry thee: and as* the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so* shall thy God rejoice over thee.+ 62.5 as the…: Heb. with the joy of the bridegroom*

I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which* shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, keep not silence,+ 62.6 make…: or, are the \+nd LORD’s\+nd* remembrancers*
And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.+ 62.7 rest: Heb. silence*

The \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be* meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:+ 62.8 Surely…: Heb. If I give, etc*
But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.
¶ Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.

Behold, the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is* with him, and his work before him.+ 62.11 work: or, recompence*
And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.
